page.title: 13Farming
page.content: One farm near Satterthwaite has sold many of its fields to neighbouring farmers, and now concentrates on {intensive egg farming}with battery hens. They have about 3000 hens in two buildings. The hens produce about 13700 eggs each week in the summer months. They are fed on mash which is constantly available, and they can always get a drink from a small nozzle on a pipe which runs the whole length of the cages. Most local people buy their eggs there as they are always lovely and fresh. All the eggs which are left over are taken to supermarkets and greengrocers in the Furness area. Eggs are also supplied to the Ormandy Hotel at Grizedale.
